newsitem.title: CHINA: Japan's Ito-Yokado inks China store pact.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Ito-Yokado inks China store pact.

text.p: Japan's Ito-Yokado Co Ltd and trading house Itochu Corp have agreed on a $130 million deal with a Chinese state-owned firm to set up 20 department stores, an Itochu Corp spokeswoman said on Wednesday.
Ito-Yokado, a leading supermarket operator, on Tuesday signed a draft contract in Beijing with Itochu and the China National Sugar and Food Wine Corp, she said by telephone.

Under the agreement, to be followed by a formal signing, Ito-Yokado would have a 36 percent stake in the venture, Itochu would have a 13 percent stake and the Chinese firm would take the remaining 51 percent.
The first stage of investment in the chain would be worth $130 million, she said, but gave no details of how it would be divided or when the formal agreement would be signed.
Construction work had already begun on some of the stores, she said.
The Ito-Yokado group includes Seven-Eleven Japan Co Ltd, Japan's largest operator of convenience stores.
